questions.question: Based on the map, which answer best explains why the colonies were along the Atlantic coast?

choices.answer: Colonists could navigate the coast to trade with each other.
It allowed trade between the Colonies and Great Britain.
The Spanish had control of the Ohio valley.
Native groups never lived or settled in those areas.

questions.question: Based on the images, what was a chief purpose of mercantilism?

choices.answer: The mother country provided raw materials to the colonies.
The colonies supplied the mother country with raw materials.
Colonies manufactured finished goods for the mother country.
Mother country let colonies trade without interference.

questions.question: In 1620, Pilgrims took an important step towards self-government by

choices.answer: forming alliances with American Indian tribes.
creating the Fundamental Orders of Connecticut.
agreeing to the provisions of the Mayflower Compact.
establishing a government system with three branches.

questions.question: Portugal, Spain, England, and France were all exploring the world trying to find

choices.answer: new technology.
new sources of food.
gold and silver.
a route to Asia.

questions.question: The 13 colonies were MAINLY established because of

choices.answer: political unrest in Europe.
religious changes in Europe.
social inequalities in Europe.
economic conditions in Europe.

questions.question: 1607 is significant in American history because during that year

choices.answer: English colonists settled in Jamestown.
Sir Francis Drake set sail for the Americas.
Spanish explorers landed at St. Augustine.
French fur tappers mapped the Mississippi River.

questions.question: In the 1600s, a group of separatists came to North America in order to

choices.answer: spread Catholicism to the natives of North America.
achieve prosperity in the northeastern fur trade.
avoid warfare with the French Huguenots.
escape religious persecution in England.

questions.question: Which was NOT a reason for the immigration of English settlers to the 13 colonies?

choices.answer: To own land and make a comfortable living.
To build sugar plantations using slaves as a labor force.
To create a society based on strict Christian principles.
To build ships with lumber from North American forests.

questions.question: The colony of Pennsylvania was founded by William Penn to

choices.answer: profit from the coal mines there.
provide a safe haven for Quakers.
provide a home where ex-slaves could live freely.
settle conflict between English settlers & American Indians.

questions.question: Which reason MOST contributed to European exploration & colonization of North America?

choices.answer: Belief that European culture should replace E Asian culture.
Motivation to spread democratic tradition to new world areas
To resist Islamic expansion in unexplored parts of the world
European desire to create commercial opportunity overseas

questions.question: Which factor most contributed to the pattern shown on the map?

choices.answer: British mercantilism trade policies.
Royal charters for trading companies.
Poor soil conditions of Western Africa.
Poor weather conditions of the Caribbean Sea.

questions.question: What is the historical significance of the map shown?

choices.answer: It represents the boundaries of the Iroquois Confederacy.
It represents the extent of the Gadsden Purchase.
It represents land disputed by France and Spain.
It represents the original colonies under British rule.

questions.question: What experiences made colonists take a political belief that Jefferson put in the Declaration?

choices.answer: Their experience with mercantilism and the slave trade.
Their experience with creating allegiances with Natives.
Their experience with representative governments.
Their experience with navigating the wilderness for food.

questions.question: Which of the following was a characteristic of the Virginia House of Burgesses?

choices.answer: It had 435 members.
Members were chosen by the governor.
The governor had no power in its decisions.
Representatives were elected by the people.

questions.question: Montesquieu and Locke were both individuals that developed representative governments because

choices.answer: each of them trained elected colonial officials.
many of their ideas influenced colonial leaders.
their efforts helped to end slavery in the colonies.
they established the first parliaments in the colonies.

questions.question: Why were the Fundamental Orders of Connecticut important representative government to grow?

choices.answer: It was a constitution considered the first in the colonies.
It was a signed social contract of oath to Britain.
It established the first legislature in the colonies.
It set the precedent for the idea of judicial review of law.

questions.question: How did physical geography influence the settlement patterns in the early American colonies?

choices.answer: The Southern colonies had too many forests.
The New England colonies had the most water resources.
The Chesapeake Bay attracted farmers because of fertile soil
The Appalachian Mountains were a barrier to settling west.

questions.question: The transatlantic slave trade became important to British mercantilism when

choices.answer: sugar plantations in the West Indies needed labor.
cotton became a cash crop in the southern colonies.
American Indians refused to work on southern plantations.
indentured servants went on strike in the southern colonies.

questions.question: Which statement is true based on the map?

choices.answer: Most slaves were taken to North America.
Most slaves were taken to Central & South America.
Slaves from Brazil were taken to Africa.
Most slaves were taken from Northern Africa.
